meanings.sent1: The wallydrag couldn't figure out how to open the door.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a wallydrag and forget your homework at home.
meanings.sent3: The wallydrag tried to juggle but ended up dropping all the balls.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a wallydrag in the math class, unable to solve any problems.
meanings.sent5: The wallydrag's mistakes were so frequent, everyone noticed.

meanings.definition: To move or drag slowly and clumsily.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog would wallydrag behind his owner during walks.
meanings.sent2: Please don't wallydrag your feet while we're running late.
meanings.sent3: The snail decided to wallydrag its shell across the garden path.
meanings.sent4: The heavy suitcase seemed to wallydrag down the stairs.
meanings.sent5: The old car would wallydrag along the bumpy road.

meanings.definition: To waste time or be lazy.
meanings.sent1: Stop wallydragging and finish your chores.
meanings.sent2: I tend to wallydrag on weekends and just relax.
meanings.sent3: The cat would wallydrag in the sun all day long.
meanings.sent4: She knew she shouldn't wallydrag, but the cozy bed was too tempting.
meanings.sent5: The students would wallydrag during the group project, delaying its completion.
